thread.title: See Skrillex and Incubus Working Together in the Studio
thread.title_full: See Skrillex and Incubus Working Together in the Studio

author: Kat Bein
title: See Skrillex and Incubus Working Together in the Studio
text:
Lester Cohen/WireImage Skrillex attends The 59th Grammy Awards at Staples Center on Feb. 12, 2017 in Los Angeles. 
We heard from KROQ music director Lisa Worde that Skrillex and Incubus had a track together on the rock band's forthcoming studio album, but it might just happen than the two musical parties are closer than they appear. 
Incubus guitarist Mike Einziger recently shared a photo of himself, singer Brandon Boyd, DJ Chris Kilmore, and Skrillex looking all business behind the mixing decks. “Nothing cool is happening right now… nothing at all,” Einziger teased. All this between Skrill's very busy scheduled running OWSLA and getting his old band From First To Last back together. 
Check the visual evidence for yourself below, and while you wait for Incubus' If Not Now, When? to hit shelves, you can also get hyped on Zedd 's ACLU-benefit concert. Both Skrillex and Incubus are slated to perform. Perhaps that show will feature a reprisal of that Einziger-assisted Grammy-stage performance of “Where Are U Now?” A post shared by michaeleinziger (@michaeleinziger) on Feb 20, 2017 at 7:30pm PST
